meta_description.title: Tetris - Wikipedia
meta_description.text: Tetris is a tile-matching video game created by Soviet software engineer Alexey Pajitnov in 1984. people_also_ask.question: Is Tetris bad for your brain?
people_also_ask.heading: Tetris had made their brains more efficient. It can even affect the shape of your grey matter. ... After a three-month period, the girls who had been playing Tetris on a regular basis showed significantly thicker cortexes than those who hadn't spent the time lining up those seven blocks over and over again.13-Nov-2018
people_also_ask.title: The Tetris Effect: how four simple tiles can help anxiety and ...

people_also_ask.question: Does Tetris increase IQ?
people_also_ask.heading: Tetris helps in developing thinking and learning skills in the majority of players. The increase in the thickness of the cortex is related to the increase in the brain's gray matter. Therefore, I am more and more becoming a better Tetris player as the level of my IQ increases as time passes by.
people_also_ask.title: Does playing Tetris makes you smarter? - EnhancingBrain.com

people_also_ask.question: What does Tetris mean in English?
people_also_ask.heading: four
people_also_ask.heading2: The name Tetris (coined by Pajitnov) derives in part from the Greek prefix tetra-, meaning "four," a reference to the fact that each block consists of an arrangement of four adjoining cubes (known among gamers as tetrominos).
people_also_ask.title: 'Tetris' is Being Used as a Verb - Merriam-Webster

knowledge_panel.description: tetris is a tile-matching video game created by soviet software engineer alexey pajitnov in 1984. it has been published by several companies for multiple platforms, most prominently during a dispute over the appropriation of the rights in the late 1980s. wikipedia
